properties.Notes: Samaritan?s Purse assumed responsibility for the CMC in Foya from MSF on July 8. The facility has been expanded and can now serve a maximum of 30 patients.
Expansion to 80 beds underway

Mid-Level Isolation Unit. Expansion to 40 beds, but no dates for completion set. The team will set up a referral unit so suspected Ebola patients can be isolated and transferred to the treatment center.

In Monrovia, an MSF emergency team is building a new tented treatment center with capacity for 40?60 beds. It is scheduled to open on July 27 and will also be run by Samaritan?s Purse. Plans to expand to 300 beds by 2nd September. An estimated 200 to 400 personnel are required to run the facility, the largest Ebola Treatment Unit.
Plans to expand to 300 beds by 2nd September. An estimated 200 to 400 personnel are required to run the facility, the largest Ebola Treatment Unit

properties.Source: http://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/news-stories/field-news/liberia-msfs-new-ebola-management-centers-already-overwhelmed http://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/news-stories/field-news/msf-begins-admitting-patients-ebola-center-monrovia-liberia; WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response; WHO data

properties.Notes: A closed primary school originally built by USAID. Residents looted quarantine centre releasing patients 17 Aug.
The unit at JFK Hospital is now functioning as a full ETU. Was initially not intended as an Ebola treatment centre (closed 27/7/14). Re-established an interim isolation unit (9/8/14-28/8/14).
properties.Source: https://www.internationalsos.com/ebola/index.cfm?content_id=396&language_id=ENG; WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response
properties.New Admissions: 17: At capacity - cannot accept any more patients

properties.Notes: Not supposed to treat Ebola, but patients ended up in the wards
There is a Holding Unit at Redemption Hospital
No partner currently identified. Renovation of the holding facilties at G. W. Harley and Ganta Hospitals is underway as at 20 August.
Open 18 Sept. Renovation of the holding facilties at Ganta Hospitals is underway as at 20 August.

The new 50 bed facility has been handed over to the County Authority and is awaiting admissions, as at 10 September. Hospital to ETC. As at 22 August, a new ETU is being constructed however it is not determined how the clinic services will be run
Expected to open 08 September
properties.Source: http://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/Liberia%20Ebola%20Situation%20Report%2005.pdf; http://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/Liberia%20Ebola%20Situation%20Report%2006%20.pdf; WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response; http://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/UNICEF%20Liberia%20Ebola%20Virus%20Disease%20Epidemic%20SitRep%20No.%2050,%205%20September%202014.pdf

properties.Notes: Bomi County Health Team (CHT) opened three, two-room quarantine units with a 12-bed capacity for Ebola patients. There is a holding centre in Tubmanburg.

properties.Centre Name: Island Clinic (Oniyama Specialist Hospital), Location: Bushrod Island
properties.Notes: A new 100-bed Ebola Treatment Unit on Bushrod Island will be functional by Week 37. A team of doctors from Uganda are likely to treat patients at this centre. 16th Sept expected opening
properties.Source: https://www.internationalsos.com/ebola/index.cfm?content_id=396&language_id=ENG; WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response; WHO data

properties.Notes: Save the Children is the constructing the ETU in Margibi County. Currently exploring possibility of Kakata as site
properties.Source: Liberia Ebola SitRep Sept 4.; WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response

properties.Notes: Public hospital
WHO deploy infection control specialist

The MSF ETU was closed in July. Request to change to ETU. MSF is supporting the Ministry of Health by transferring Ebola patients by ambulance for case management in either Conakry or Gu?k?dou. Patients are arriving from a wide area, including the region around Nzerekore
The situation has stabilized in some areas and MSF has closed its Ebola treatment center in Telim?l?, in the west of the country, after no new cases were reported for 21 days
To be set up
To be set up
Expected to increase to 100 beds. To be re-located outside the township of Kenema
properties.Source: https://www.internationalsos.com/ebola/index.cfm?content_id=397&language_id=ENG; WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response; WHO Data

properties.Notes: Tented Structure. 2-5 beds to start, scale up to 60 later (will increase gradually by 10 patients per week) The IFRC is establishing the new facility (on 22 August, was expected to be functional "soon"). Plan to open 10 Sept. The isolation facility in Kenema Government Hospital, is to be re-located outside the township of Kenema, a few miles from Hanga. All new cases will be treated at the centre in Kailahun until the new centre is ready.
properties.Source: https://www.internationalsos.com/ebola/index.cfm?content_id=397&language_id=ENG;  WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response

properties.Notes: MSF treatment centre, concidering expanding to 100 beds
Referral site.If patients are determined to have Ebola they are then transferred to the isolation facility.
Referral site.If patients are determined to have Ebola they are then transferred to the isolation facility.
With assistance from a medical team from King's Health Partners, UK
Maculy Street Hospital is being renovated to act as an isolation unit.
MSF is constructing a 35-bed isolation centre. Will start with a few beds and slowly scale up to 35 (will gradually expand up to 70 beds)
Transit Centre

Holding Centre. Construction should be completed approx 05 Sept and will be operational on 14 Sept; EMERGENCY will provide staff, clinical management, & logistic support, & the MOH will provide nurses; Training carried out for staff on 5-6 Sept.
properties.Source: WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response

properties.Notes: 100 beds for patients, plus 12 separate beds designated for staff. UK: Assistance in 3 ways: (1) UK Dept of Defense to provide 12 beds dedicated for staff-related cases. (2)  UKDFID to finance Save the Children for 50 beds (3) Currently in discussion re:  possibly financing IMC for other 50 beds. British military personnel will begin to survey and assess the site during week 37. Based near the capital Freetown. The UK government is working with Save the Children to design a long term plan to manage and operate the facility after it has been fully set up.
properties.Source: WHO Foreign Medical Teams International Response; http://reliefweb.int/report/sierra-leone/uk-treatment-centre-tackle-ebola-sierra-leone
properties.Centre opening date: Projected opening date between 18 Oct ? 01 Nov.

properties.Notes: A holding centre has been established and as at 12 September is expected to be "operational anytime"
Hospital where first patient with Ebola in Nigeria was treated

Hospital, ETU and Isolation Unit.Treatment centre: 40; Isolation ward: 8; Suspected cases tents: 48. Lagos State Government said that it has set up a 40-bed complex with male and female wards for management of confirmed cases of Ebola Virus Disease as well as an eight-bed isolation ward to hold suspected cases backed up by two emergency tent to hold 24 more suspected cases of the disease following the guidance from the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (CDC) and other supporting partners.
An isolation unit has been established at Oduoha, Emohua. The centre currently has 26 beds "with plans for possible expansion" announced on 3 September
A quarantine centre is being established
Identified to be isolation centres for Ebola cases

properties.Centre Name: Delta State University Teaching Hospital Oghara
properties.Notes: Identified to be isolation centres for Ebola cases

properties.Centre Name: Central Hospital of University of Fann (Dakar (Clinique des Maladies Infectieuses/CHU Fann)
properties.Notes: First case of Ebola in Senegal. Student presented himself to hospital. Placed in isolation in the infectious disease ward of Fann Hospital.Open ( beds within existing hospital) ? is also the only triage point in Senegal at the moment.

properties.Centre Name: Central Hospital of University of Fann (Dakar (Clinique des Maladies Infectieuses/CHU Fann)
properties.Notes: Preparation. Will be a tent set up as a separate structure near the Clinique des Maladies Infectieuses/CHU Fann to become the ETU and handle any cases from the Clinque.

Preparation. The WHO has classified Togo as a ?border country? of epidemic - affected countries because of the air traffic with Asky Airlines, whose hub is based in Lom?. As a result an isolation centre has been set up. In addition, many people travel by bus to / through Togo from Nigeria, but also Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. Five other sites are identified in the other 5 regions. But not yet equipped. The health staff were trained.

properties.Centre Name: CNAM Centre National d'Appui ? la lutte contre la Maladie
properties.Notes: Preparation. Establishment of isolation wards
